content.title: Financial Assistance for Education (GBOCWWB)
content.beneficiary: Workers registered with the Goa Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board
content.details: 'Financial Assistance for Education (GBOCWWB)' is a Welfare Scheme by the Goa Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of the Department of Labour and Employment, Government of Goa. Through this scheme, the worker registered with the Board is provided with financial assistance, as determined by the Board, for the education of their children. The applications are accepted offline.
benefits: Financial Assistance, as determined by the Board, for the education of the children of the Worker.
eligibility: The applicant should be a Worker registered with the Goa Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
The worker should be between 18 to 60 years of age.
The worker should have completed ninety days of service as a registered worker in the year.
The ward of the worker should be pursuing education.
documents_required: Receipt of Payment of First & Last Subscription with the Board.
Educational Certificates/Marksheets of the Latest Qualifying Examination.
Proof of Admission/Enrolment into the Institute.
Proof of Identity of the Student.
Affidavit of the Parent of the Student, signed before MLA/MP/Panchayat President/Gazetted Officer of the State or Central.

faqs.question: Who oversees the operations of the Goa Building and Other Construction Workers' Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: The Labour Commissioner of Goa serves as both the Member Secretary and the Chief Executive Officer of the GBOCWWB.

faqs.question: How can one apply for registration of establishments employing building workers in Goa?
faqs.answer: Employers can apply for registration through the Labour Department's online portal by filling out Form-1 and paying the applicable fee based on the number of workers proposed to be employed.

faqs.question: What is the age-related eligibility criteria for registration under the Building and Other Construction Workers Act in Goa?
faqs.answer: The age of the worker should be between 18 to 60 years of age in order to be eligible for registration.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria regarding the service period for registration under the Building and Other Construction Workers Act in Goa?
faqs.answer: The worker should have completed 90 days of service in the year in order to be eligible for registration.

faqs.question: Can a worker who is also a member of some other fund register under the Building and Other Construction Workers Act in Goa?
faqs.answer: No, a worker who is also a member of some other fund is not eligible to register under the Building and Other Construction Workers Act in Goa.

faqs.question: How long is the validity of the registration certificate issued under the Building and Other Construction Workers Act in Goa?
faqs.answer: The registration certificate issued is valid until the contract is in force and is not renewable or transferable.

faqs.question: Who are the registering officers responsible for processing applications under the Building and Other Construction Workers Act in Goa?
faqs.answer: The Deputy Labour Commissioners for North and South districts have been designated as registering officers under the Act.

faqs.question: How can citizens register their grievances with the Public Grievance Department in Goa?
faqs.answer: Citizens can convey their grievances by registering on the official website (goaonline.gov.in), completing the grievance details, attaching supporting documents if any, and submitting the application. They should note the acknowledgement number for tracking the status.

faqs.question: What subjects/topics are not considered as grievances by the Public Grievance department in Goa?
faqs.answer: Subjects such as RTI matters, judicial matters, religious matters, suggestions to the government, and grievances of government employees concerning their service matters are not treated as grievances.

faqs.question: Who serves as the First Appellate Authority for matters related to the Labour Department in Goa?
faqs.answer: The Commissioner of Labour & Employment acts as the First Appellate Authority for matters related to the Labour Department in Goa.

faqs.question: What is the fee structure for registration of establishments employing building workers in Goa?
faqs.answer: The fee varies based on the number of workers proposed to be employed, ranging from ₹500 for up to 50 workers to ₹5,000 for exceeding 400 workers.

faqs.question: What is the role of the Account Officer in the registration process under the Building and Other Construction Workers Act?
faqs.answer: The Account Officer serves as the Public Information Officer throughout the State of Goa and handles registration-related inquiries and processes.
